comment.text:
Hands down best Japanese restaurant in Georgia. Traditional sushi, traditional dishes, and if that's not your thing they also have Americanized dishes as well.

Ling is the best server I've ever had and very sweet and informative. Will sit in her section every time

owner_replies.comment:
We're proud to be your favorite spot for Japanese food, Samuel! Our staff is the best of the best, and we're glad you felt taken care of while you were here. Come back and see us soon for more traditional Japanese dishes! 

Best wishes, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: This is by far my favorite Japanese restaurant in Atlanta! Incredible food and two distinct atmospheres for dine-in. One side is a lively hibachi grill and the other is a quiet, sexy, sushi bar / dining room. We also order takeout all the time and it's just as good and well presented. Chateaubriand filet in hibachi is phenomenal, as is the teriyaki chicken and shrimp/lobster. Worth the money every time; generous portions. Experienced and creative sushi chefs with signature roles. Family owned for almost 50 years, they even send personal thank you notes with takeout sometimes. Highly recommend, for special occasions or anytime you want to splurge. Very good food & people!

photos.caption: Filet & Shrimp Hibachi combo, take out.

owner_replies.comment:
Bradley, we know Atlanta has some incredible restaurants, so it means the world to us to hear we rank so high on your list. We're proud of our lively teppanyaki hibachi and our traditional tasting room, and we're glad you appreciate them as well. From our family to yours, we can't wait to welcome you back. 

Warm wishes, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: Yummy and efficient with take out orders. The place looked nice, I'd eat inside next time.

owner_replies.comment: Lee, it's great to hear we impressed you with our tasty food and efficient service for your takeout order! We'd love to have you dine in sometime, and look forward to serving you. -Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
My boyfriend and I visited Nakatos on a Thursday night. We did have a reservation and were sat immediately. Our regular spot is Benihana's but visited Nakato since the downtown location was shut down. We ordered the Astro Boy flavored fishbowl which was really good. We're pretty frequent drinkers though so between the both of us it was like having one strong drink. 
For our entrees I ordered the teriyaki chicken with fried rice. He ordered the shrimp and chicken. Honestly my favorite part of the meal were the garlic noodles and shrimp. The service was good as well. I definitely would visit again!

photos.caption: Garlic noodles and veggies(broccoli, mushrooms, onions, zucchini)
Mushroom soup. I hate mushrooms but love this soup.
Ginger salad. I could have used more lettuce and less ginger dressing.

owner_replies.comment:
Kalimah, the Astro Boy is great to split! We're glad you and your boyfriend had a good time, and it was nice that he shared his dish with you! It's fun to find new favorites and get to try different things. We hope to see you both back for date night! 

See you soon,
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: DELISH! Also got the egg drop soup and i love how simple it was. Just the broth & green onions.

owner_replies.comment:
We're so glad you had such a great experience at Nakato, Claire! So happy our simple egg drop soup won you over. We can't wait to welcome you back soon to try more  of our dishes. 

Until then, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
Came here for someone's birthday. Great valet service. The waiter was friendly taking everyone's orders. I told him I do not eat meat only seafood.  Someone in my party ordered sake and loved it! Everyone was having a good time at the table until we realized a party that came in after us was already having their meal cooked front of them and a party who was seated less than 10 minutes prior was having their salads. We brought this to the attention of our waiter and then a manager. They quickly got a chef out to cook for us. The manager even confirmed the arrival time each party. 

Our chef didn't have all of the enthusiasm as the other chefs but perhaps he was tired. We enjoyed him non the less. After cooking the meal the chef was trying to be nice by giving me some of the left over chicken. It was already on my plate before I could stop him. 
Once he realized his mistake and that picking it out wasn't an option he made my entire meal over. This was real service to me!  
They also sang to the birthday girl in our party.

The next time I comeback I'll try one of the tables with seats on the floor next time.

owner_replies.comment:
Dawn, I'm happy to hear you enjoyed your time here and that our team impressed you. We can't wait to welcome you back to Nakato again soon. 

Best, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: Excellent Service and a Professional, Knowable and Friendly Restaurant! I was there with a Party of three for my Birthday 2/4/22 and we had a Great Time! We will be back!

owner_replies.comment:
You can always count on us for friendly service, Martha. We appreciate you choosing to celebrate your birthday with us. Hope to see you back for more great times in the future.

Best wishes, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
Yummy! Yummy! Yummy!! The Hibachi here is extremely tasty and according to my friends who kept requesting the sushi filled with cream cheese. The service was great and the drinks were tasty. I gave them 4 stars for a few reason. The noodles were different so when we asked our cook what type of noodles they were his response was that he didn't know. Um, sir, as the cook I'm going to need you to be well versed in what you're serving. 

Secondly, the hibachi room that we were in was kinda dirty and the carpet that we had to place our feet on was kind of creepy and dark. They should probably consider putting down hardwood.

Overall it was a good time and food.

photos.caption: Wall in the Hibachi Room needs Cleaning

owner_replies.comment:
Tonya, I'm happy you thought we were yummy! I'm sorry the cook didn't clarify what kind of noodles were being used. This should be an easy question for our knowleadgeable staff. As for seating, we use tatami mats because that is what is traditionally used in Japan. I'd love to have you back in so we can answer your culinary questions! 

See you soon,
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: Nice service. Very beautiful and delicious birthday sushi cake. I just ordered and curbsite pick up but next time Iam gonna try to dine in.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for supporting us!  We appreciate it.  =)  We are open everyday from 4-9pm for both dine in and curbside pick up as well as delivery.  We look forward to seeing you in person soon!  Til then, please be safe and healthy!

comment.text: Thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant for date night with Bae. We made a reservation and were seated promptly. It wasn't crowded so we had a chef to ourselves- and he was the highlight. Personality out the yazoo, the food was quick and deelicious and he gave us all of the extra sauce with no issues. (I'm a sauce person.) We'll definitely be back!

owner_replies.comment:
Love, we're so glad you thought Nakato was a stellar date-night spot! Aside from the fun you had with the chef, it's great to hear you enjoyed everything you ordered. Thanks so much for the kind words here -- we can't wait till you join us again! 

Sincerely,
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: Sushi and service was great nice ambiance. Hibachi was good but have had better. Would recommend

owner_replies.comment:
Nothing compares to our fresh sushi, Courtney! Hope to see you back for more delicious meals in the near future. 

Best wishes, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
Disappointing ... bad sushi ... the noodles they give u taste like spaghetti ... the habachi grill was disappointing... my shrimp was rubbery and overcooked :/ I give it two stars instead of one because it was very nice inside they even had tradition Japanese rooms


11.16.18 Update
I am changing my review from 2 stars to 3 because the company offered to correct my experience with my next visit being comp'd. Unfortunately, I live out of state and I'm not sure when I will be returning. I appreciate Nakato management reading my review and trying to make it right.

This place is really the best! I've gone a few times and decided to try the curbside service today! It was delicious and fast as always! I ordered the shrimp and scallops hibachi dinner both times. I've also had the chicken skewers, dumplings and a sushi roll! 

Though I can't recall the sushi roll name I remember it being small! I mean really small but flavorful! Like one of the best sushi rolls I've ever had. The chicken skewers were small pieces of chicken for the price but they were also delicious! I liked that the shrimp dumplings were soft and filling and the sauce that came with them was good. As for the miso soup and salad with ginger dressing, there were standard as far as any hibachi restaurant goes but still flavorful with fresh ingredients! The shrimp and scallops dinner was a lot! My friend and I shared everything and we still had leftovers. The shrimp were plump the shrimp fried rice was done right and I loved how large and sweet the scallops were! 

The service was simple so I can't say much on that being that one order was Uber eats and the other was curbside. So no complaints there. I would definitely say Nakatos is far better than Benihana'a! So go and enjoy!! 

Highly recommend!

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you so much Sophia for taking the time to write your review.  We greatly appreciate your support and are thrilled that you enjoyed all of the dishes so much.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Warm Regards,

Sachi Nakato Takahara

comment.text: Had a wonderful experience here! My partner took me here on a lunch date and it did not disappoint! The Spicy Tuna Crispy rice is a must. We ordered it twice. We  also really enjoyed the King Kong roll. The Gindara was marinated very well and flaky. Just wish the portion was larger.

owner_replies.comment:
Tylen, I'm glad you and your partner had a wonderful date at Nakato. We'd love to welcome you back for more spicy tuna crispy rice and your favorite rolls. We look forward to serving you again very soon!

Until next time, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
This is my favorite Japanese Restaurant in Atlanta. I've been looking for tradicional Japanese food on Yelp and Nakato did not disappoint, quite the contrary.
 Food is amazing, ambience is great and the service, impeccable. 
From the wine list, including a great variety of sake and japanese whiskey to the vast food menu, everything I've tried so far, was amazing.
Oishikatta desu!

photos.caption: Sushi bar area and amazing decoration with Japanese lamps and Tsuros origamis.

owner_replies.comment:
Junior, we're happy to have exceeded your expectations for traditional Japanese food in Atlanta. There's nothing quite like drinking a glass of wine (or sake) while looking at the garden. Thanks for saying it was delicious!

Come back soon,
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: This was my second time visiting. I must say The hibachi was not the same. The rice had corn which I don't remember from before, the food was bland and the chef was not entertaining. He also did not serve the appetizer shrimp. The yum yum sauce was off. The best item was crispy tuna

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Venetia, we're truly sorry to see you left feeling this way. We have included corn in our fried rice for the past 20+ years, and have not changed the recipe due to the positive feedback we receive from our guests.  

We are sorry that our chef forgot to serve your shrimp and was not entertaining. Please email debbie@nakatorestaurant.… with some additional information such as when you dined with us and if you know the name of your chef, and we will make this right with you.

Again, please accept our sincerest apologies.

comment.text: AMAZING service! Food was delicious too and atmosphere was great. I'd also recommend following their Instagram page!

owner_replies.comment:
Thanks for appreciating the care we put into our food, service, and social media. It was wonderful to have you dine with us, and we're looking forward to your next visit. 

Until then, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: Got hibachi for a birthday dinner. Although it was a large group admittedly, the service wasn't that great or coordinated. Food was good, but in my opinion not justifiable by the price. I would rather get hibachi at somewhere like Kani House or Fumi for the value. Overall, the food was good but not fantastic. Ambience was lively and on the classier side.

owner_replies.comment:
David, thanks for joining us to celebrate. We were happy to have your group here, and if there's ever anything we can do to make your visit better, we would love it if you could let our manager know. We're always happy to accommodate you!  We hope to welcome you back in the future. 

Warm wishes, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: Great Japanese restaurant with good food, tasty drinks, and fast service. They are operating quickly even during this time, and they seat you almost immediately.

owner_replies.comment:
Gabrielle, we're so glad you enjoyed everything during your recent visit to Nakato! Thanks for joining us and for your support -- we'd love to welcome you back to Nakato again soon. 

Best, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
I have been here a few times in the last 10 years but have not been here in about 4 years.  I thought my experience would have been like the other times but overall I was disappointed. 
We booked on open table and had a reservation. Once we arrived we still had to wait 30 minutes past the reservation time to sit at Hibachi. We later found out the restaurant canceled out open table reservation. 

Once seated, I ordered the steak (medium rare) and lobster.  The fiancé ordered the filet and shrimp with white rice.  The hibachi chef was funny and entertaining. 

While cooking all our meals, he must have misjudged the amount of filet to be served because he forgot my fiancé.  I noticed he asked a server to bring another filet, which he started cooking about half way through.  The fiancé finally received her steak about 15 minutes after everyone else got theirs.  She also had to ask the chef like 3 times for the white rice she ordered.  He just kept saying yes it's coming. We finally asked the waitress and she brought it. 

My meal (steak and lobster): the steak was cooked to medium well, even though I ordered medium rare.  I noticed he took off the steak of someone sitting next to me about 4 minutes before mine.  The steak was just ok (would have been better if it was the right temp).  
The lobster was cooked well.  The problem was of the 8 pieces, 4 of them still had shells attached.  Nothing like paying for lobster and biting into crunchy pieces. 

Highly disappointed in the service and overall atmosphere in this place. This used to be a go to but they definitely failed in numerous areas.

owner_replies.comment:
Ron, we're proud that we used to be your go-to, and we are so incredibly sorry that we fell short on your last visit. 

Please email debbie@nakatorestaurant.com with additional details about your experience, including the chef's name, if you have it, and we will make this right with you. 

Sincerely, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: This place is pretty good. Really expensive but hey, it's hibachi in Atlanta. Their waitlist is always packed and it's so hard to get a reservation. If you wanna eat here, book a day before. The valet is a nice touch and the look of the restaurant is really nice for a date night. I don't like how they charge extra for fried rice because of course you're at hibachi for the fried rice but whatever. The food is good though and I love how they add the noodles. Definitely will be back after I get paid on a Friday lol

owner_replies.comment:
Maniah, thanks for joining us for teppanyaki hibachi! We're happy to hear that you enjoyed dining with us, and we can't wait to welcome you back to enjoy more delicious Hibachi. 

Warm regards, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: If your looking for sushi roll I highly recommend this place. I order for pickup and it was super fast and good service :)

owner_replies.comment:
Yuliska, we're so glad you enjoyed your sushi and really appreciate your support! We'd love to welcome you back for more pickup or to dine with us in our dining room.

Until next time, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: Everything was so nice and the food was tasty.  They put us in a private hibachi room for our group which made it even nicer.

owner_replies.comment:
Jay, tasty meals and a fun atmosphere will always be here for you. Our private rooms are a great way to enjoy the full experience of our hibachi grills. Be sure to come back and see us soon. 

Until then,
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: We came here as a family for my cousins birthday. He's 12. The food was just ok. I love hibachi!! But the food just didn't do it for me. There was no seasoning

owner_replies.comment:
Jai, we're really surprised to see this review. Our chefs are always happy to hear feedback to ensure you love your meal! Please email debbie@nakatorestaurant.com and we will make this right with you.

Sincerely, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
I recently had the opportunity to dine at Nakato Japanese restaurant. I love that they're celebrating a milestone anniversary in the Atlanta area and for good reason. The food is delicious and the restaurant itself is so very unique.

I had no idea that Nakato boasts four types of dining at their restaurant. They have traditional style Japanese dining, a sushi bar, a Hibatchi Teppanyaki grill AND the most awesome Tatami Rooms! 

A Tatami Room is a traditional Japanese tea room and it is unlike any other dining experience in Atlanta. The Tatami room experience is beyond anything you can imagine. It's a wonderful journey in Japanese culture. When entering the room we were asked to remove our shoes. I was wearing espadrille heels and was fairly thrilled with the request. We were seated on the floor on ultra comfortable seats and cushions. The atmosphere was reminiscent of a relaxing spa day, but with exceptional food and drink.

Our first taste of Nakato's grand menu was an aperitif of shiso shochu served in beautiful blue and gold glasses. The shiso shochu was accented with shimmering gold flecks in the beverage and was divinely delicious. After came dish after stunningly beautiful dish of King Crab Salad with Apple Vinegar, and the Five Point appetizer which included spectacular five point appetizer which included "miso" grilled black cod, slow cooked "tsubugai" sea whelk, salmon terrine, fried "kawaebi" river shrimp and "sera mame" broad bean. 

That was followed by traditional savory custard "chawanmushi", then miso grilled eggplant, tempura and yakitori skewers. Chef Kinjo then brought out a stunning array of fresh sushi options, the finally dessert. 

If you're looking for the most spectacular, unique meal in Atlanta, this is exactly what you're looking for.

Nakato is split into two seating areas: hibachi and traditional Japanese dining/sushi. This is for the traditional dining. 

If you check in on Yelp, you can a BOGO sushi roll. We also got the sashimi plate. We got 6 different type of fish that all tasted fresh. 

For the main entree, we got the seafood hotpot. They already prepared the ingredients in the pot before they bring it to the table. Ready to eat. The seafood included crab legs, shrimp, scallops, couple of mussels, squid, some type of white fish. Tofu, cabbage, carrots, and onions completed the pot.  The flavors were all there, though I wished for more clams and mussels in the soup. 

Matcha creme brulee and ice cream completed this night of great food. 

The servers were super nice and attentive. Some were wearing kimonos which is a nice touch.

Forced me to remove my shoes, which lace up the leg so took forever.... can't wait to try to put them back on. 
 and now I'm sitting here like an idiot with a bunch of people that smell like feet.  Several people have been shown to the table and refused to sit here which is making our meal take much longer than it should. 

Not appetizing. This isn't Japan. Wtf.  Get it together youguys stop making people remove their shoes to sit at a table that's not even technically on the floor. There is leg room under the faux floor where your shod feet could totally rest without disturbing the chi or whatever. Womp. 

Now to eat my meal while I'm smelling rotten foot stench YUM.

*update 
The table across from us is getting shrimp launch fun and our chef didn't even offer. The shrimp launch is half the fun.

owner_replies.comment:
Angela, we're truly sorry to hear you left feeling this way.  When you make a reservation at Nakato, you can choose which area you would like to dine in our Hibachi Room. We strongly suggest making reservations as we do tend to get quite busy.

Since we opened in 1972, we have prided ourselves on bringing the traditions and culture of Japan for people to experience and enjoy in Atlanta. We apologize that you did not care for it, and hope you make a reservation for your next visit, and enjoy another area of our restaurant.  Warm Regards and Happy Holidays!

Sincerely,
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
I want to start by saying I feel that nakato is was one the best hibachi restaurants ITP, but my experience this past Friday was less than ideal. I feel like Friday is a busy day for them and it showed with the valet. Cars were lined up almost into the street and it seemed like they didn't have enough valet workers to move the cars at a decent pace. 

We had a reservation for 830PM and my party was all there on time. We weren't sat until 9PM. Our server Jackson was really nice! He brought the birthday person several sake shots. Our chef on the other hand wasn't as lively. We expected a great hibachi experience especially with it being a birthday but I definitely feel like it was rushed. 

The sushi rolls we ordered were really great! It took them a while to come out but they were really great and fresh! Our chef however overlooked my steak I believe. I know I ordered the regular sirloin but it was so thin and tough. I should've paid the extra $10 for filet mignon. Everything else was decent but slightly over cooked. I hope upon my next return I experience better quality in the future as it is one of my favorite spots!

photos.caption: King Shrimp Roll and Spicy Salmon Roll

comment.text: We love Nakato! We have dined there for many holidays and birthdays over the years and most recently on Christmas Eve 2020 which was our first time being there since covid. We felt like they were taking all of the necessary precautions, parties were spaced out, all of the staff were wearing masks, patrons wearing masks when not seated, etc. The traditional hibachi food is always delicious. My son loves the garlic noodles they do on the grill. All of the sushi we have tried is also very good. The meals are pricey but it's a lot of food and we always have leftovers!

owner_replies.comment:
Kelly, it means so much to us that you have made many happy memories here over the years. Thanks for appreciating the safety measure we're taking to keep everyone safe. We look forward to serving you again soon.

Until next time, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
I would never come back. 
This is by far the worst dining experience I've ever had in the United States, and they canceled my reservation on open table so I can't even comment there.
The waiter took a long time to actually show up at the table, I ordered sukiyaki, and the waiter did not cook it right because the first few pieces he threw in was just too old(and I've been to Japan enough times to say that this is NOT what sukiyaki is supposed ti taste like. 
There were no instructions given as to how to properly enjoy the mea", the waiter just did his thing and left. Last time I had sukiyaki in New York the waiter continuously came back to check on the pot with a full room of people. Today the restaurant is almost empty and the waiter still managed to just go MIA and left me clueless with the pot. There was no water given, which caused the sukiyaki sauce to quickly decay into a burning matter, and it took me so many times to actually get the waiters attention to go and get some water. 
When I left the restaurant I left a complaint at the front desk. However the lady was not really giving any response, which just made the whole experience worse.
Last time I was here there was actually a good experience. This is no offense but garbage. 
I don't usually complain about things but I'm just really sad about the whole experience. This is my birthday meal and I couldn't even finish the meal because of how burnt the whole thing tasted.  I left with more than half of the food untouched.
I got the agedashi tofu, which was fine. The sukiyaki and the service really let me down. I would not come back to this restaurant and I advice others to not go. I'm usually a generous tipper but this experience was so bad I didn't want to tip at all. I ended up giving something like a dollar and I am still thinking it was not worth it. If I can I would give this restaurant no stars at all.

owner_replies.comment: We are so sorry that this was the case with your most recent dining experience.  As you know from previous visits to Nakato, we pride ourselves on offering a wonderful dining experience for all of our guests, and we're so sorry that we fell short with you.  We would like to offer a re-do and have you come in for another Sukiyaki dinner - one that we are proud to serve you.  Please email debbie@nakatorestaurant.com to let us know when you'd like to come back in.  Again, please accept our sincerest apology for your most recent dining experience with us.

comment.text:
It's really hard to beat the happy hour deal of $15 for FIVE (small) plates and a cocktail (even if I don't drink). This was a great experience to try new items. I was so excited to see what will come out next. The pacing of bringing the food out was just right.

Seafood roll. Yes, it was a WHOLE roll with 8 pieces. It was generous with different types of seafood.

Spicy yellowtail roll. It was adequately and satisfactory spicy. This is good value.

Goma ae. Eating healthy feels and tastes good. There was a generous amount of spinach.

Seared white tuna. Nothing to write home about.

Salmon skin salad. The ginger dressing is separate so you are in control of how much you put in your salad. Salmon skin was scarce but good. This salad was fresh and the salmon skin was the cherry on top.

Gyoza. Very good. Skin has the right amount of chewy consistency.

Slowly cooked pork. It was a bit dry but roll it around the sauce for maximum flavor.

Panko shrimp. It was done right.

Ume shiso roll. Even though the overwhelming (plum?) flavor was too much for me, I was still distracted by the fishy seaweed paper. I don't know how this can be improved.

Calamari tempura. It was ok.

I sipped on the cocktails and both tasted like medicine to my amateur drinking taste buds.

Service is friendly and competent.

Free parking is on the Piedmont side of the restaurant but there's valet parking on the Chesire Bridge side, too.

I came here for dinner with my boyfriend on a Sunday night. You are forced to valet park so there was a line waiting for the valet.

This restaurant splits into two side, one is for teppanyaki and one is for the traditional dining (if you want sushi roles, tempura, etc.). Most people were waiting to be seated at the teppanyaki side so we were seated immediately since we just wanted the regular stuff.

You should check in on yelp and get BOGO sushi roll!! You can do either a specialty sushi roll with a regular roll or two regular rolls. I ended getting the specialty roll with soft shelled crab and the rainbow roll. We also ordered the Chirashi. Everything was great! The chirashi comes out super pretty and there's two pieces of almost everything (eel, salmon, tuna, egg, etc.) so it's good for sharing between two people. The staff here were friendly and food was decent. Hope to come back here again!

I don't plan on coming here again. The steak was not seasoned AT ALL and was severely overcooked (I ordered medium and each piece seemed to be varying levels of well done to unchewable). I am trying to contact Uber eats in regards to getting a refund. Their rice also had no flavor. I don't know if this is because I did not sit down at the grill, but this was so disappointing. I don't recommend eating here. I also ordered right when they opened, so I do not see an excuse for them being busy.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Jayna, We're so sorry you had this experience.  This is certainly not the high level of cuisine that we are known for, and for that we deeply apologize.  

Our chefs are always happy to hear feedback to ensure you love your meal! Please email debbie@nakatorestaurant.com and we will make this right with you.

Sincerely, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: The exterior of the restaurant is decorated quite nicely. There is a main dining area and a hibachi section, which is where I ate. The portion sizes are big enough to fill you up, and the food is great. Highly recommend the crispy spicy tuna and, for the main course, filet mignon. This was my first time having hibachi, and it was a great experience.

owner_replies.comment:
Nothing satisfies the flavor and crunch urge quite like our crispy spicy tuna, Ibaad! We're glad to hear you enjoyed our teppanyaki hibachi while you were here. Looking forward to having you back for another exceptional experience soon! 

Sincerely, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: New favorite in Atlanta! The food was delicious and the service was fast and extremely friendly. Excited to bring more friends and family!!

photos.caption: Absolutely loved this place. The lavender gin fizz and sour matcha cocktails were amazing !

owner_replies.comment:
Rochelle, we're thrilled to be your new favorite spot in Atlanta. It means so much to know you enjoyed our food and service, so we can't wait to welcome you back with your friends and family. 

Best,
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
We both ordered the filet and shrimp hibachi. We were not impressed at all for the money. Again like everyone is saying-"great packaging."

The fried rice was awful. It had corn  in it!  No flavor. We paid $3.25 extra for it. . The shrimp were not much different from any other restaurant with shrimp. The Filet was great. We both ordered the same thing, but for almost $100 bucks?!?!?!? Come on. The sauces were great! 

Sorry but not going back and cannot recommend

owner_replies.comment:
Tony, I'm so surprised to see you did not enjoy our fried rice - it's been a staple recipe that our guests have been enjoying for more than 40 years.  However, we are glad that you loved our hibachi Filet. We do use only the absolutely finest ingredients, as a family-owed business it's important to us to maintain a level of high quality for our guests.  That's why our dishes cost a bit more.  

We do hope you will order again from us and give another opportunity to wow you with the wonderful, authentic Japanese dishes we have become known for. 
 We are always happy to make suggestions to you in the future.  We greatly appreciate your support.

Sincerely,
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
Friday night plan -- lay low with one of my girls and recharge after a difficult month. A day of reservation on OpenTable offered late dining options, so I called the restaurant and they fit us in at an earlier time for the sushi side of the house. Complimentary valet and nice touches from the start..."enjoy your meal" he says before driving off with my car. We're guided to a spacious table near the window and settle in to the dimly lit dining room. The atmosphere was tranquil with the occasional birthday celebration and song.

I can eat tofu all ways. Agedashi tofu to start, lightly fried with ground radish and scallions in a tempura sauce. Next up: Dragon Roll (amaebi or shrimp tempura on the inside and eel/sauce on the outside) and a White Kelp Roll (soft shell crab inside covered in white kelp). Gentle and fresh flavors with both rolls, and don't overlook the fried shrimp heads on the plate. Crunch Crunch. My friend rounded out her meal with Chilean sea bass and mushrooms in a seaweed broth with ponzu sauce, served mini hot pot style over a flame. Hot Tea, Wine and a BOGO sushi offer on yelp. 

Good night, guaranteed return.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you so much for the review!  We look forward to serving you again soon.  Have a great rest of the weekend.

comment.text: Complementary valet parking was a good start (because finding parking in Atlanta is crazy). As soon as we entered we were greeted right away. They had no problem finding our reservation (recommended). Since Valentine's day is this week they had a cute Valentine's day photo booth (which me and my daughter loved). Now back to food and drinks. The Tokyo Tea is a must! Do not be fooled by the "tea" cause the drink will hit you. The food was tasty, well prepared, the presentation of the plating was perfection. I ambiance is dim and romantic. The service is topnotch. We never had to ask for our glasses to be refilled or plates to be removed. The restroom is gender neutral, clean, and roomy (has no changing table but the sink top is huge). Overall, this is a keeper in my restaurant must book.

owner_replies.comment:
Nicole, we're all so glad to hear you and your daughter had a wonderful time with us. You can always count on us for stellar service and delicious food, and we can't wait to welcome you both back to Nakato.

Warm wishes,
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: Love the food here the specials are awesome. The service is fantastic. Look forward to my big event on the 24th have 24 people going

owner_replies.comment:
Jennie, we love that you enjoy our specials so much. We're dedicated to providing excellent service, and we look forward to seeing you and your group here in a few days! 

Until then, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
It was busy when we got there tonight. There's no self parking but they had complimentary valet parking which was overwhelmingly busy too.

We waited for 30 minutes for traditional dining. We were lucky to have Erika as our server. She was extremely friendly and was on top of her game. Great service! 

My girls had the Nabeyaki udon noodles and they loved it. My husband and I had the 15 piece sashimi platter, spicy tuna roll and the California roll as well. The California roll isn't your usual California roll. We ended our dinner with a chocolate mousse cake. Scrumptious! Everything was delicious. 

Service was excellent and the staff were wonderful!

This place is never not a good time. If you don't know, Nakato is a hibachi restaurant, so you literally see your food cooked in front of you. They place you in rooms, Japanese style, meaning no shoes, so make sure your socks match amongst other things to not embarrass yourself. Also they will sit you side by side with other people outside your party so be prepared for that.

Upon getting there, there is complimentary valet and inside is pretty peaceful. It's not too loud but it sounds populated. I never had a drink from here but the food is amazing but pricey so prepare to spend some cash.

Everytime I come I order the calamari steak, which is basically calamari chopped up into cubes. It's delicious. I eat it with fried rice and yum yum sauce. These meals all come with mushroom soup, and a iceberg lettuce salad with some strange brown sauce on it. It's not bad but it's a bit different. I recommend trying it first to see if you like it. I can definitely see someone not liking it. 

As for the waiter service, impeccable. They are very attentive and are always looking out for your needs. As for the overall experience, it is pretty cool. You'll get the onion volcano, the spinning eggs and fire flares. Just be prepared because somehow I always get caught off guard when the fire part starts.

Lastly for the checks, PAY ATTENTION. They add their gratuity in them already for you. I don't go often but I always forget and tip extra. Which isn't bad but I gotta keep a budget and still tip the drivers. Overall it is definitely a good restaurant to experience. This place definitely has my seal of approval.

owner_replies.comment:
Darrian, we're thrilled to have your seal of approval. The calamari steak is a great option -- it sounds like you have good taste. We hope to see you back at Nakato soon for more entertainment and delicious food. 

Best,
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: This was my first time having hibachi in years, and Nakato provided a great experience! The servers and chef were great. It was very entertaining to watch, and we got  LOTS of food. The teriyaki chicken was delicious, and the sauce they served made it even better!  It was my boyfriend's birthday, so they sang him a song and brought him ice cream with a candle, which was sweet. Look forward to returning!

owner_replies.comment:
Bahar, we're so glad you were entertained with our teppanyaki hibachi and you both had a great dinner.  We hope your boyfriend had a fantastic birthday, and we look forward to welcoming you both back again soon. 

Warm wishes, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: Hibachi should NOT be this expensive , PERIOD , I've had cheaper hibachi that taste better. For the price their charging the portions should be a little more and the food should have a little more flavor. Decor & ambience was nice. The carpet where the hibachi tables are , is quite gross. First & last time at Nakato.

owner_replies.comment:
Ne'kea, thank you for dining with us. Our prices allow us to serve fresh food and employ the best chefs, but we're always happy to make recommendations to make sure your meal wows you. We would be happy to welcome you to dine with us again. 

Sincerely, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text: My wife and I made a reservation and was told to sit and wait, so we did. We sat there for 20min. We then watched 2 men walk up without a reservation and was seated. I am not sure if it was a race thing, discrimination because we are lesbians, or just bad customer service. I have been coming here for years and told her great things. I was very disappointed to get this service and I will NEVER be back.

owner_replies.comment: Brionne, this is Sachi from Nakato.  I just saw your review and immediately talked to our manager to figure out what happened.  We had your reservation on the main garden dining area vs the teppanyaki area, so when the walk-ins came to be seated at the teppanyaki area, we had them seated right away, not knowing you wanted to dine with us on the teppanyaki area.  I am so sorry for the mistake and would like an opportunity to make it right.  Please email me.  sachi@nakatorestaurant.com

comment.text: Oh my god. The best sushi I've had since Japantown in San Francisco, which I thought could never get equaled.  Fresh, delicious, creative, fabulous. ONLY issue is wait staff is also the table side grill and hibachi chef so that takes them away from the customers and we had to wait a few times to order more, which we couldn't stop doing. Had a little bit of everything. But having this here in Atlanta is amazing and its now our go to for all Japanese cuisine. Going back for sure.

owner_replies.comment:
Deb, we're glad to have raised your sushi expectations even higher. Thanks for bringing the wait to our attention -- we use your feedback to improve. Please know that you can also dine in our Garden Dining Room and enjoy Sushi and authentic Japanese cuisine - which would be a much more focused experience. We hope to welcome you back soon to celebrate your love of authentic Japanese cuisine. 

Until then, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
We went to Nakato for a quick dinner and they did not disappoint. It appears that for large tables a reservation is strongly suggested on a weekend! The sushi is fresh, the service is accommodating and friendly, and the overall price point is excellent. I ordered a rainbow roll and some sashimi which was reduced nicely by the bogo checkin option yelp offers here! Hari (spelling?) was an excellent server and she offered sake ordering advice that was on point.

The noise here is not bad but I assume if you are at a hibatchi table it will be noisier than average. 

I'm ready to take on the evening on a full stomach! Also they will give a receipt and let you carry out the sake bottle if you don't finish!

Something for everyone.  Beautiful and professional staff. Awesome experience. The patrons were just as fun and awesome as the staff. The sushi was yummy and delicious. My cousin opted for the hibachi. He has shellfish allergies so they made his plate in the kitchen. Everyone enjoyed their meal. The evening was pleasant and we all look forward to going back there again.  They have 2 parking lots one it the front (valet parking) and one in the back.  Definitely a spot to hit up in Atlanta

photos.caption: Sushi. Ummmm so good. Spider roll, rock & roll,  crunch roll, Illuminati roll & rainbow roll

owner_replies.comment:
Tai, we're so delighted to hear that you had an awesome experience at Nakato. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your  review - it means so much to us. We'd love to welcome you back to Nakato again soon!


Best,
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
I'll start with the good. Fun atmosphere for large parties. People laughing and having a good time. Service was attentive and who I believe was the manager was very kind, with a staff who often checked in on us. 

Unfortunately, I can't say the same about the food. We were first served soup that was cool, Luke warm at best. Sent it back to be heated. Then we had sushi, the rice was mushy and flavorless, had the same type of taste as some type of supermarket sushi. Not good. We noticed part of the grill was cooking food too fast. The fried rice taste burnt, so I ended up opting for steamed...which was ok. The food all taste oily, lack of seasoning and just plain bland. The prices are insane compared to most hibachi spots, yet doesn't offer high end product for its cost. I definitely wouldn't return.

owner_replies.comment:
Bianca, I'm happy you appreciated our atmosphere and service. That said, I'm truly disheartened to see that you left feeling this way about your food. We pride ourselves on our qualities and flavors, and this is so unlike us. We would love it if you would consider giving us another chance and possibly dine in our dining room in the near future.  Please email debbie@nakatorestaurant.com and we will make this right with you.

Sincerely, 
Sachi Nakato and Restaurant Staff

comment.text:
When we arrived there was only 1 valet guy on sight so getting our car took a good bit. The host had our reservation and sat us promptly. 
The food was amazing but the service as always was slow. 
The hibachi side is super fun as the cooks always find a way to make the show fun and exciting! When I checkin in through Yelp I received a BOGO sushi roll! 
I got the steak for dinner and it was delicious. I especially love coming here because they give you rice and noodles!! 
We did inform our server that we were celebrating MY birthday that night (my sister reminded her a total of THREE times) but she never cared to sing/ or do the birthday celebration routine for me.

Beni-Who!?

I'm DEFINITELY a fan!  I like the look and feel of Nakato's and my service is ALWAYS exceptional.  The staff is very quick to clear your used bowls and dishes, as the food is flowing in perpetual motion.

They have valet parking, which I normally shun, but always use here for its convenience.  I think the pricing is appropriate in comparison to other Hibachi restaurants that I've visited and the food is MOS DEF, non-pareil in comparison - Hibachi GOODNES! =)

Somehow, someone is ALWAYS celebrating a birthday when I go, so it has a tendency to get AND be loud, but it doesn't bother me; Personally, I enjoy and appreciate the energy...Just stating a recurring tendency for any lovers of quiet dining.
